videoData.title: Why social media is reimagining our future
videoData.socialTitle: Why social media is reimagining our future

nodes.whoTheyAre: Bryan Kramer is a social business strategist and the CEO of PureMatter, where he’s led his agency to consistent growth over the last 10 years, earning a spot as one of Silicon Valley’s fastest-growing private companiesby the Silicon Valley Business Journal. He is the author of the bestselling book "Human to Human: #H2H." He has extensive experience in brand marketing with a focus on integrated communications and strategic business planning.

videoData.description: Bryan Kramer believes that social media is so popular because it allows us to control our personal brand: aligning the perceptions others have of us with our perception of ourselves. Concluding with a live Twitter experiment to test the true reach that sharing can have, he makes a case for the use of social media, and -- in the process -- illuminates the reason over 700 million photos and videos are processed on Snapchat every day.
videoData.socialDescription: Bryan Kramer believes that social media is so popular because it allows us to control our personal brand: aligning the perceptions others have of us with our perception of ourselves. Concluding with a live Twitter experiment to test the true reach that sharing can have, he makes a case for the use of social media, and -- in the process -- illuminates the reason over 700 million photos and videos are processed on Snapchat every day.
